conversation.content: [flatly] Estes números não batem certo.
A que números te referes exatamente? Há várias reconciliações a acontecer em vários fundos, e às vezes os relatórios trimestrais ficam atrasados em relação aos desembolsos reais.
[measured] As contribuições para as pensões de outubro a dezembro mostram 3.2 milhões depositados, but the fund balance only increased by 1.8 million during that same period.

[carefully neutral] A volatilidade do mercado afetou significativamente os retornos no quarto trimestre, e tivemos vários pagamentos programados para reformados que podem explicar a discrepância que estás a ver.
[withering] As perdas de mercado não aparecem como contribuições que nunca chegaram à conta, and I've been doing this for fifteen years, portanto não insultes a minha inteligência, por favor.
Eu não estava a sugerir—

Olha, eu represento oitocentos trabalhadores que têm pago para este fundo as carreiras inteiras deles, expecting it to be there when they retire. [exhales] Agora, onde é que foram parar esses 1.4 milhões?

[dangerously quiet] Realocação temporária é uma forma muito criativa de descrever desvio de fundos, and the CFO's approval doesn't make it legal when it violates federal pension protection laws.

A empresa estava a enfrentar processos de falência se não conseguíssemos pagar os salários durante dois meses, o que significaria toda a gente perder os empregos de qualquer forma. [strained] Às vezes têm de se tomar decisões práticas.
[building anger] Decisões práticas? Vocês apostaram com dinheiro que não pertence à empresa, money that workers earned through decades of labor and sacrifice.
Tudo vai ser reembolsado com juros quando os novos contratos chegarem no próximo trimestre, and no one needs to know about this temporary situation that's already being resolved.

[icily] Só que eu já sei, e sou legalmente obrigado a reportar isto ao Departamento do Trabalho dentro de vinte e quatro horas após a descoberta, which gives you about twenty-three hours to figure out your next move.

[desperately practical] Se denunciares isto agora, a empresa vai à falência, o fundo de pensões fica congelado em litigação durante anos, and those eight hundred workers get maybe pennies on the dollar. [pause] Isso é mesmo protegê-los?
Não te atrevas a tentar fazer-me cúmplice do teu crime ao fingir que isto é sobre proteger trabalhadores, when you've been stealing from them for months.
[quieter] Tenho documentação que mostra o plano da administração para restaurar tudo dentro de noventa dias, including a secured line of credit specifically for pension restoration. Dá-me esse tempo.
[firmly] Tens até às 17h de amanhã para repor cada cêntimo nesse fundo, with a full audit trail I can verify independently.

Isso é impossível, só a linha de crédito demora duas semanas a processar, e liquidar ativos para cobrir isto imediatamente desencadearia investigações que afundariam tudo de qualquer forma. [defeated exhale]
[standing] Então é melhor começares a fazer uns telefonemas, because at 5:01, I'm calling the feds, e as tuas decisões práticas tornam-se acusações federais.
Espera, por favor, tem de haver outra maneira de navegar isto que não destrua tudo aquilo pelo qual todos trabalhámos. [hollowly] Eu nunca quis que chegasse a este ponto.

original_conversation.content: [flatly] These numbers don't match.
Which numbers are you referring to exactly? There are several reconciliations happening across multiple funds, and sometimes the quarterly reports lag behind the actual disbursements.
[measured] The pension contributions from October through December show 3.2 million deposited, but the fund balance only increased by 1.8 million during that same period.
[carefully neutral] Market volatility affected returns significantly in Q4, and we had several scheduled payouts to retirees that might account for the discrepancy you're seeing.
[withering] Market losses don't show up as contributions that never hit the account, and I've been doing this for fifteen years, so please don't insult my intelligence.
I wasn't suggesting—
Look, I represent eight hundred workers who've been paying into this fund their entire careers, expecting it to be there when they retire. [exhales] Now, where did that 1.4 million actually go?
[defensive] There were emergency operational expenses that required temporary reallocation of funds, all properly documented and approved by the CFO with every intention of repayment.
[dangerously quiet] Temporary reallocation is a very creative way to describe embezzlement, and the CFO's approval doesn't make it legal when it violates federal pension protection laws.

The company was facing bankruptcy proceedings if we couldn't make payroll for two months, which would have meant everyone losing their jobs anyway. [strained] Sometimes practical decisions have to be made.
[building anger] Practical decisions? You gambled with money that doesn't belong to the company, money that workers earned through decades of labor and sacrifice.
Everything will be repaid with interest once the new contracts come through next quarter, and no one needs to know about this temporary situation that's already being resolved.

[icily] Except I already know, and I'm legally obligated to report this to the Department of Labor within twenty-four hours of discovery, which gives you about twenty-three hours to figure out your next move.

[desperately practical] If you report this now, the company goes under, the pension fund gets frozen in litigation for years, and those eight hundred workers get maybe pennies on the dollar. [pause] Is that really protecting them?
Don't you dare try to make me complicit in your crime by pretending this is about protecting workers when you've been stealing from them for months.
[quieter] I have documentation showing the board's plan to restore everything within ninety days, including a secured line of credit specifically for pension restoration. Give me that time.
[firmly] You have until 5 PM tomorrow to get every single penny back into that fund, with a full audit trail I can verify independently.
That's impossible, the credit line alone takes two weeks to process, and liquidating assets to cover it immediately would trigger investigations that would sink everything anyway. [defeated exhale]
[standing] Then you better start making some phone calls, because at 5:01, I'm calling the feds, and your practical decisions become federal charges.
Wait, please, there has to be another way to navigate this that doesn't destroy everything we've all worked for. [hollowly] I never wanted it to go this far.
